data.title: Yende Richard Mangum - Unexpected Substitution lyrics
data.meta_description: Lyrics for Unexpected Substitution by Yende Richard Mangum. {{lyrics_excerpt}}
data.text:
Traducciones

Letra de Unexpected Substitution de Yende Richard Mangum

Manage your expectations

Mind games is expansive

I damage imaginations

Emancipating hating that came from a place of savin

Where dying means respect and the rest of us lie in waiting

Debating

Contemplaining bout the places the H take us

The communities that they touch

And the unity they want

Put all of me on the line for my city

And the few who grew with me

From olney down to chickies

I know mount airy ain′t the scariest place to be

But youd be very mistaken to say may fair isn't me

I′m aware. various nights i was grateful

Situations turning out tastefully

I gotta move hastily

Where oldheads schemin youngbouls over a meek

And you went and shot ya homie over what he made in a week

And you seeking to find peace of mind but mine is free

And you wonder if i know what it means

To never have while you never knew you didn't

Fuck who with it you gotta get it

And no i'm not offended

I learned lessons from people with no teachers

The streets preachers will put you in detention

A deficit of attention

Yo poppa is on suspension

For pretending to make all of the money he sending

You mother just got rear ended

Not to mention your sister is out on stanton

Sending in the reserves

Standing out of line for some strawberry preserve

Same time your classmate livin in a mansion

Your man′s Yen ain′t heard, so he asking what happened

Now grandma gotta move cause they opened a anthropologie

Fucking the wealth gap by livin with no apologies

In philly the prophecy is die or be killed tryin

The tears done ran dry, the cryin won't stop the violence

You blaming all of us but the problem is you

Shame on you for giving us no opera tunes

They claiming it′s fuck the rules but won't change the public schools

Speaking from experience we just wanted lunch foods

That didn′t make us throw up

They hate what we grown into

But if you listened to us

You wouldn't be so resentful

And eventually ima go back i promise

I gotta get through college regardless

And bring your umbrellas I′m just tellin it honest

When i hit spring garden I'm making it rain dollars

Obviously that's the bad now it′s time for the good

What other city you know put the hood in childhood

We put you on to all of your favorite sayings

The first the birthplace, the greatest in the nation

We invented the tangin and we gave you the roots

And uz, when we fightin together we never lose

Whether it′s swift or garcia or dion

Talk shit we jack your son up like desean

Time to dine, we ain't waiting in line

Broad street line we all night on that bike life

Gave sprout the shout south street with the nightlife

Living in the lime light wasn′t really my type

We got the goats from Coltrane to Kobe

City of kings and queens you feel me right there

They love to say it's bad things happen in philly

Fuckin with us we turn your dream to a nightmare

Writer(s): Yende Mangum

Contribuir

Por hacer
